The expert analyzed the claim made by Se: Rand Paul on "The Daily Show" regarding the percentage of uninsured Americans who make more than $50,000 a year.
The expert examined the most recent Cens: which showed that 15.7 percent of Americans are uninsured.
The expert reviewed a September 2012 pap: This paper found that 28 percent of the uninsured earned at least $50,000, which is lower than what Sen. Rand Paul had indicated.
The expert also considered the variation: noting that uninsured young adults who are roommates might collectively make more than $50,000 in a household, even if each individual earns less. This living arrangement can inflate the count of uninsured adults who "earn" more than $50,000.
